channel.title: ★★SMH Ultra Advanced Help Utility Tool★★ [BRAND NEW RSPS PRIVATE SERVER TOOL]
channel.description:
[center]WAITING FOR BANNER[/center] [center][size=12pt]SMH is the newest innovation in RSPS, providing high quality support for private server owners everywhere. SMH is a professionally made program by our team of intuitive and highly skilled programmers. Our goal is help server owners troubleshoot their RSPS problems as soon as possible, without the need of an internet connection if the circumstances are called upon, waiting is not an option and their server(s) economies for example are in jeopardy, or a help community is simply unavailable at the time. [/size] [size=18pt][b]CURRENT SMH STATUS[/b][/size] [size=12pt]As of this moment, the program is 100% free, and SMH 8.0 is in the Alpha stage and NOT ready to be tested by the community.[/size] [size=12pt]Our team works rigorously to make sure SMH is bug free and meets our own standards, as well as fulfilling our clients' needs to help them get through any troubles they have while running, servicing, or setting up their private servers. Here is some proof that we are INDEED working on a new version SMH, in this case SMH 8.0. [code][hr] [b]smh-batch-compiler[/b] I was writing SMH v8.43 and during development I realized that the batch programming language needed a good modern compiler (the last stable compiler was by Intrango industries around 1999, unfortunately). I decided to tackle the issue using the language Java. Below I will show a sample of how to use the compiler, with the class files [i]main.class.cmd[/i] and [i]helper.class.cmd[/i].
java -jar smh-batch-compiler.jar compile bin/executable.cmd src/main.class.cmd src/help.class.cmd
[i]src/main.class.cmd[/i] [code=batch]// All new compiler commenting, which do not get parsed by the compiler! // This is a main class. :main ECHO Welcome to the main class. goto help[/code] [i]src/help.class.cmd[/i] [code=batch]:help ECHO Welcome to help. PAUSE[/code] Output file, [i]bin/output.cmd[/i] [code=batch]@echo off REM Batch executable compiled by smh-batch-compiler. goto main :main ECHO Welcome to the main class. goto help :help ECHO Welcome to help. PAUSE[/code] [/code] [/size][/center]

item.title: ★★SMH Ultra Advanced Help Utility Tool★★ [BRAND NEW RSPS PRIVATE SERVER TOOL]
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

Davidi2:

That’s not gunna fly, sorry. That’s not a tool, it’s a tutorial list download. People can just copy and paste tutorials relevant to their server if they are worried about their internet being down often. If it’s for specific server sources, you can reply to the source downloads with your compiled list ‘tool’, and maybe they can add it to their OP.

But SMH wont only have these features, these were primal features only included by the careless previous owner who neglected SMH, but I will be adding new features, such as a command generator for example, and I am also developing an IDE made specifically for batch so updates and new features can be added to SMH as soon as possible.

Besides, there are no “tutorial lists” or links to tutorials.

Read full topic

item.title: ★★SMH Ultra Advanced Help Utility Tool★★ [BRAND NEW RSPS PRIVATE SERVER TOOL]
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:4, topic:544742”]If it is one batch file with text and a ‘table of contents’, it is literally a useless download and you can create a tutorial topic that uses internal links to do the same thing. If you want an example you can look at the download list, because it looks like what you made was literally just a collection of tutorials. Unless you provide an actual tool in a non-troll format this thread will get removed, that’s just the way it is.

You have one day to edit the OP. Nobody else reply (looking at you, Driman/Ashi) until the OP has been updated please.[/quote]
This program gives you the ease of access of having all of these tutorials in one simple program to use from the convenience of your desktop, for example, if you need some help for your server, and either the persons internet is down or moparscape is down, smh will be there as an offline support entity to help the user through his/her rsps endeavors.

Read full topic

item.title: ★★SMH Ultra Advanced Help Utility Tool★★ [BRAND NEW RSPS PRIVATE SERVER TOOL]
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

Davidi2:

I stand by what I said last time. It was not only the topic wording itself that was a troll, it was the entire utility you made. I’ll wait and see what you update the topic with but if it’s the same thing it was last time (a batch file with tutorials we already have here) then don’t expect this topic to stay.

But that batch file was the whole thing?.. And I am just going to add more features in 8.0, its not all tutorials it was written years ago by the person who passed it down to me and now I continue work on it. Everything is in this one batch file, making things a lot easier.

Read full topic

item.title: ★★SMH Ultra Advanced Help Utility Tool★★ [BRAND NEW RSPS PRIVATE SERVER TOOL]
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[center]WAITING FOR BANNER[/center]

[center][size=12pt]SMH is the newest innovation in RSPS, providing high quality support for private server owners everywhere. SMH is a professionally made program by our team of intuitive and highly skilled programmers. Our goal is help server owners troubleshoot their RSPS problems as soon as possible, without the need of an internet connection if the circumstances are called upon, waiting is not an option and their server(s) economies for example are in jeopardy, or a help community is simply unavailable at the time. [/size]
[size=18pt]CURRENT SMH STATUS[/size]
[size=12pt]As of this moment, the program is 100% free, and SMH 8.0 is in the Alpha stage and NOT ready to be tested by the community.[/size]

[size=12pt]Our team works rigorously to make sure SMH is bug free and meets our own standards, as well as fulfilling our clients’ needs to help them get through any troubles they have while running, servicing, or setting up their private servers.

Here is some proof that we are INDEED working on a new version SMH, in this case SMH 8.0.

[code][hr]
smh-batch-compiler

I was writing SMH v8.43 and during development I realized that the batch programming language needed a good modern compiler (the last stable compiler was by Intrango industries around 1999, unfortunately). I decided to tackle the issue using the language Java. Below I will show a sample of how to use the compiler, with the class files main.class.cmd and helper.class.cmd.

java -jar smh-batch-compiler.jar compile bin/executable.cmd src/main.class.cmd src/help.class.cmd

src/main.class.cmd

code=batch// All new compiler commenting, which do not get parsed by the compiler!
// This is a main class.
:main
ECHO Welcome to the main class.
goto help[/code]

src/help.class.cmd

ECHO Welcome to help.
PAUSE[/code]

Output file, bin/output.cmd

code=batch@echo off
REM Batch executable compiled by smh-batch-compiler.
goto main

:main
ECHO Welcome to the main class.
goto help

:help
ECHO Welcome to help.
PAUSE[/code]
[/code]
[/size][/center]

Read full topic
